intro: Osmorhiza longistylis var. brachycoma, commonly known as the shortstyle boneset, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
